file_content.text: Now--the consoles. Let's hope they have even half of the information Deadfall could have given us.
Got a hit--multiple deliveries from Pol Blex. He's an arms smuggler here on Voss.
Blex must be smuggling weapons to the Empire. Blast, we've been watching the wrong ships.
What is Blex's location?
I'll find out for sure.
Why would the Imperials pay someone else to bring them weapons?
That seems strange.
To make a buffer, obviously. If the smugglers are caught, the Empire can deny everything.
It's a shot in the dark, nothing more.
Sounds unlikely to me.
If you have any better leads, feel free to pursue them.
I'm forwarding the pickup coordinates from the Imp files. Looks like a good place for Blex to be hiding out.
Go there and question him right away, Major. And I mean that--don't just go in shooting this time.
Good luck.
If I may add, sir, this area is also home to the Shrine of Healing. It is a sacred place in Voss culture and presents many diplomatic opportunities.
How does this Shrine of Healing tie into our plans?
What do you have in mind?
This doesn't really sound like my kind of place.
I don't need healing.
Nonsense. I'm told the structure is quite beautiful.
I'm not playing diplomat here, Koru.
Don't waste my time.
Ah, but you are uniquely qualified for this situation.
Entering the Shrine of Healing requires the completion of a very dangerous series of trials. Few outsiders have ever gained entry.
By completing the trials, you would further demonstrate to the Voss that we are worthy of their friendship.
I'm always glad to prove the Republic's worth.
Then I'll do it.
We'd better keep it fast. We wouldn't want those arms smugglers to get away from us.
Hmm. A useful pursuit, but I would advise against straying from our primary objective for too long.
Once they see Havoc Squad in action, the Voss will surely scramble to join our noble cause!
Ugh. Wake me up when we decide to do something fun.
Overcoming these trials could give us a deeper knowledge of this place, and aid our hunt.
I'm certain you'll find the experience worthwhile.
I'll try, Koru, but the mission has to come first.
We'll see if there's time.
Agreed. We don't want those arms smugglers to get away from us.
Agreed, sir. It's worth investigating, but not at the expense of our primary mission.
I believe we should take every available opportunity to demonstrate the superiority of the Republic!
Forget the shrines. Let's see what those arms dealers have in stock.
I'm not risking my neck for this nonsense.
Forget it.
No kidding. We've got an invasion to stop, here.
I have to agree, Major. Investigating these arms smugglers is far more pressing.
I see no risk at all--no trial is too difficult for Havoc Squad!
No joke. I'm way more interested in seeing those arms dealers than a bunch of crazy Voss.
Finding harmony in our surroundings could lead to a better understanding in our hunt.
I leave the matter to your discretion, but your help would be invaluable.
Also be warned that this area is one of many infested by the Gormak, a dangerous local race that has warred with the Voss for centuries.
One of the locals, Suva-Rak, can tell you much more. Good luck.
Major! You were supposed to capture him alive! You were supposed to bring him in for questioning!
It won't happen again, Senator.
I'm sorry.
Good. There's no more room for mistakes here.
Some men never surrender.
That isn't always possible.
Save your excuses. I'm not interested.
I'm in the field. I can't chat every time you get upset.
Go annoy someone else.
If you can't handle supervision, Major, then I'll find someone who can.
I... I'm speechless. Is it always like that in the field? Is there always that much killing?
It's unfortunate, but it's necessary.
I'm afraid so.
A gruesome necessity.
I just do what I have to do, Senator.
All part of the job.
It's hard to believe we've come to this.
War is just a killing contest, Senator. And I like to win.
It's what I do best.
The leader of the Republic's finest is nothing but a bloodthirsty thug. How did we come to this....
Enough. Let's just get on with the assignment--I have Agent Kellor here from the SIS to assist us.
My team will take care of the heavy lifting, Major. Just flip the consoles on and we'll slice right in.
Don't move a finger--I've got you dead in my sights. I'll kill you where you stand.
There's been enough killing in here today--let's talk.
Take it easy.
I'll decide when there's been enough. I'll decide when my men's lives are paid for.
You must be that guerrilla fighter I've been hearing so much about.
Deadfall, I presume?
You aren't asking the questions here--I am.
You want answers, come and get 'em.
You don't scare me.
If that's what it takes--so be it.
This is your chance, Major--take him into custody for questioning!
I'll be back with you in a minute, Senator.
We'll talk later.
Good luck.
Go ahead and convince him to surrender--I'll wait.
You talk to him.
Err... Deadfall, listen! Killing these soldiers won't help you--we know where you are. You can't escape.
Err... Deadfall! Listen--even if you kill this soldier, we have your location. We'll send reinforcements--you won't escape.
Why not make things easier on yourself? The Republic treats its prisoners fairly--just surrender, and you won't be harmed.
Shut it off. The time for talk is over.
We can end this without more violence.
Don't be too hasty.
No. We can't.
Some men just can't be reasoned with.
Nice try, Senator.
Trying to talk to scum like you is pointless.
I agree.
This isn't the time for a chat, Evran.
Shut up.
Hmm. Agreed.
I don't plan on surrendering. Do you?
Surrender isn't an option.
No.
Just put your weapon down, and we'll talk.
Your plans can change.
The day I put this weapon down will be the day your Republic has finally fallen.
"Surrender" isn't in my vocabulary, scum.
Dream on, Imp.
Then let's finish this.
